Robert Dion said until Mike Pence gave up his House Republican leadership role, he expected Mike Pence to target another position: the U.S. House speaker's podium. I've been telling people for a couple of years now that if I were him, I would have my eye on the speakership. He's got a reasonably safe seat, and he was in the leadership of the House Republican conference, and people liked him. I'd stick around and keep my eye on that, he said.
